description.narrative:
The Millennium Challenge Corporation's (MCC) Board of Directors in its quarterly meeting on September 13,2023 discussed recent developments in Niger. On August 24, MCC announced a pause on all preparatory work?on the Niger Regional Transport Compact due to the military's actions against the democratically elected government. These actions and recent events in Niger are contrary to MCC's statutorily mandated eligibility criteria and the agency's commitment to democratic governance and upholding the rule of law. All MCC partner countries are expected to demonstrate an ongoing commitment to these principles to remain eligible for MCC investments. Acknowledging the continued state of affairs in Niger, the Board approved the suspension of all MCC assistance to Niger.
Niger Regional Compact: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

condition.narrative: Delivery of a completed Disbursement Request form, together with the periodic reports required under Section 5.1 of this Agreement, in each case in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period.

Each of the Governmentï¿½s representations and warranties set forth in Section 4.1 of this Agreement are true and correct on and as of the date on which the Disbursement Request is submitted and as though made on and as of such date.

Evidence of Tax Exemption Mechanism. MCC is satisfied that the Government has entered into a tax exemption agreement or such other mechanism acceptable to MCC to establish or give effect to Section 4.2(k), and such mechanisms are in full force and effect.

Fiscal Agent Services. Designation of an entity or individual to provide fiscal agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Fiscal Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Fiscal Agent engaged thereby is mobilized;
If requested by MCC, delivery of a Fiscal Agent Certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period.
If requested by MCC, delivery of a Permitted Designee or MCA Certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period.
If requested by MCC, delivery of a Procurement Agent Certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period.

Initial Disbursements to a Permitted Account. Prior to an initial Disbursement of any Grant funding to a Permitted Account, a true and complete copy of each Bank Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect as of the date of the related Disbursement Request.
Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan. Adoption of an Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan acceptable to MCC;

No material breach of any responsibility, covenant or obligation under this Agreement or any other related agreement by any Permitted Designee has occurred and is continuing on and as of the date of the Disbursement Request.

Prior to any disbursement of the Grant for the MCC Contracted Activities, the Government will have entered into a tax exemption agreement or such other mechanism acceptable to MCC to establish or give effect to Section 4.2(k), and such mechanism will be in full force and effect.

Procurement Agent Services. Designation of an entity or individual to provide procurement agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Procurement Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Procurement Agent engaged thereby is mobilized;
Satisfaction of each of the conditions set forth in Section 3.4.

description.narrative:
The Millennium Challenge Corporation's (MCC) Board of Directors in its quarterly meeting on September 13,2023 discussed recent developments in Niger. On August 24, MCC announced a pause on all preparatory work?on the Niger Regional Transport Compact due to the military's actions against the democratically elected government. These actions and recent events in Niger are contrary to MCC's statutorily mandated eligibility criteria and the agency's commitment to democratic governance and upholding the rule of law. All MCC partner countries are expected to demonstrate an ongoing commitment to these principles to remain eligible for MCC investments. Acknowledging the continued state of affairs in Niger, the Board approved the suspension of all MCC assistance to Niger.
In 2018, MCC's board selected Benin and Niger as eligible to develop regional compacts to allow the countries to work together to reduce poverty and build inclusive, sustainable economic growth throughout their region. Strengthening regional trade is a top priority for the governments of Benin and Niger, and the Regional Transport Compact will advance this shared priority with a grant of $504 million: $202 million for Benin and $302 million for Niger, with an additional contribution of $15 million each from Benin and Niger.
The trade corridor between the port of Cotonou in Benin and the capital city of Niamey, Niger is one of the busiest crossings in West Africa, with up to 1,000 vehicles crossing per day, a high percentage of which are trucks carrying goods to market. Strengthening and rehabilitating this corridor will allow goods to flow faster and more efficiently through the Port of Cotonou, reaching additional markets in the region and beyond. The compact will include two projects: the Corridor Infrastructure Project and the Efficient Corridor Operations Project.

The Millennium Challenge Corporation's (MCC) Board of Directors in its quarterly meeting on September 13,2023 discussed recent developments in Niger. On August 24, MCC announced a pause on all preparatory work?on the Niger Regional Transport Compact due to the military's actions against the democratically elected government. These actions and recent events in Niger are contrary to MCC's statutorily mandated eligibility criteria and the agency's commitment to democratic governance and upholding the rule of law. All MCC partner countries are expected to demonstrate an ongoing commitment to these principles to remain eligible for MCC investments. Acknowledging the continued state of affairs in Niger, the Board approved the suspension of all MCC assistance to Niger.
The Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Niger Regional, monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

These actions and recent events in Niger are contrary to MCC's statutorily mandated eligibility criteria and the agency's commitment to democratic governance and upholding the rule of law. All MCC partner countries are expected to demonstrate an ongoing commitment to these principles to remain eligible for MCC investments. Acknowledging the continued state of affairs in Niger, the Board approved the suspension of all MCC assistance to Niger.
The Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Niger Regional, project administrative costs, which include staff salaries, financial audits, and fiscal and procurement agent fees.

description.narrative:
The Millennium Challenge Corporation's (MCC) Board of Directors in its quarterly meeting on September 13,2023 discussed recent developments in Niger. On August 24, MCC announced a pause on all preparatory work?on the Niger Regional Transport Compact due to the military's actions against the democratically elected government. These actions and recent events in Niger are contrary to MCC's statutorily mandated eligibility criteria and the agency's commitment to democratic governance and upholding the rule of law. All MCC partner countries are expected to demonstrate an ongoing commitment to these principles to remain eligible for MCC investments. Acknowledging the continued state of affairs in Niger, the Board approved the suspension of all MCC assistance to Niger.
Niger Regional Compact - Regional Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (Corridor Infrastructure Project): By improving 210 kilometers of roads in both countries, the project aims to reduce vehicle operating costs and increase travel speeds, leading to faster and more efficient transit for goods between markets and along the transport corridor. The installation of road safety infrastructure is also expected to reduce road accidents and, in turn, reduce the risk of injury and death to road users.

Niger Regional Compact - Regional Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (Corridor Infrastructure Project) - Road Rehabilitation Activity: the Activity seeks to rehabilitate approximately 210 kilometers of road across both countries focusing on 83 kilometers of road between Bohicon and Dassa in Benin and approximately 127 kilometers of road between Niamey and Dosso in Niger.

description.narrative:
In July and early August 2023, elements of the military of Niger took actions against the democratically elected government of Niger, detained the president and key ministers, and asserted to have suspended the constitution and dissolved state institutions. In response, in August, MCC paused all new activity on the 2016 Compact and all preparatory work on the Concurrent Compact.
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors concurred with the recommendation of the MCC CEO to suspend all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

condition.narrative: Adoption by the Government of an Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan acceptable to MCC
Adoption by the Government of an Interim Procurement Operations Manual acceptable to MCC
Delivery of a completed Conditions Precedent Report in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed Disbursement Request in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period

Delivery of a completed Disbursement Request, together with the periodic reports required under Section 5.1 of the Grant and Implementation Agreement, in each case in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed Fiscal Agent Certificate in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed MCA-Niger Certificate in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed Procurement Agent Certificate in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed Procurement Performance Report in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period
Delivery of a completed Quarterly Financial Report/Detailed Financial Plan in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period

Designation by the Government of an entity or individual to provide fiscal agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Fiscal Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Fiscal Agent engaged thereby is mobilized;

Designation by the Government of an entity or individual to provide procurement agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Procurement Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Procurement Agent engaged thereby is mobilized

Each of the Governmentï¿½s representations and warranties set forth in Section 2.1 of the Grant and Implementation Agreement are true and correct on and as of the date on which the Disbursement Request is submitted and as though made on and as of such date

If requested by MCC, delivery of a certificate from each of the Government, the Permitted Designees, the Procurement Agent and/or the Fiscal Agent, in each case in form and substance satisfactory to MCC

MCC is satisfied that the Government has fulfilled all domestic requirements to ensure tax exemption status of all Grant funding, or has adopted such other mechanism acceptable to MCC to establish or give effect to Section 2.2(l), and such mechanisms are in full force and effect

No material breach of any responsibility, covenant or obligation under this Agreement or any other related agreement (including the Bank Agreement, the Fiscal Agent Agreement, the Procurement Agent Agreement and any Service Provider Contract) by any Permitted Designee has occurred and is continuing on and as of the date of the Disbursement Request

Prior to an initial Disbursement of any Grant funding to a Permitted Account, a true and complete copy of each Bank Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect as of the date of the related Disbursement Request
Satisfaction of each of the conditions set forth in Section 3.4 of the Grant and Implementation Agreement

title.narrative: Access to Land and Water for Agriculture and Livestock

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Access to Land and Water for Agriculture and Livestock project: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Non-allocated Funds - Non-allocated Funds activity: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

Niger - Program Assessments - Environmental/Social Oversight Consultants activity: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Safety and Security Assessments - Safety and Security Assessments Activity: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

description.narrative:
In July and early August 2023, elements of the military of Niger took actions against the democratically elected government of Niger, detained the president and key ministers, and asserted to have suspended the constitution and dissolved state institutions. In response, in August, MCC paused all new activity on the 2016 Compact and all preparatory work on the Concurrent Compact.
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors concurred with the recommendation of the MCC CEO to suspend all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
MCC's $437 million Niger Sustainable Water and Agriculture Compact supported improvements to three major constraints to economic growth and investment in Niger: lack of reliable access to water for agricultural use and livestock; lack of access to markets; and a fragmented and inefficient business regulatory system. In partnership with the Government of Niger, the MCC compact aimed to strengthen Niger's agricultural sector by improving water availability, infrastructure, and market access, and has the potential to benefit more than 3.9 million people.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project: The Climate-Resilient Communities Project aims to increase incomes for small-scale agriculture-dependent and livestock-dependent families in eligible municipalities in rural Niger by improving crop and livestock productivity, sustaining natural resources critical to long-term productivity, and increasing market sales of targeted commodities. The project will be implemented in partnership with the World Bank through existing project implementation units ("PIUs") located in the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock. Regions of intervention for this project are Tillaberi, Dosso, Tahoua and Maradi.

The Government will have adopted the Facility Manual

description.narrative: Cumulative Output of There were data quality issues with the value from the region Tahoua. The tables in the reports had discrepancies between the disaggregated values and the total. MCA M&E was unable to resolve these issues during the closeout period. MCC decided to take the lowest of all displayed values. Because of this, no sex disaggregation was added for this region. The sex disaggregation therefore only comprises the regions Dosso, Maradi, and Tahoua.

comment.narrative: There were data quality issues with the value from the region Tahoua. The tables in the reports had discrepancies between the disaggregated values and the total. MCA M&E was unable to resolve these issues during the closeout period. MCC decided to take the lowest of all displayed values. Because of this, no sex disaggregation was added for this region. The sex disaggregation therefore only comprises the regions Dosso, Maradi, and Tahoua. Baseline

There were data quality issues with the value from the region Tahoua. The tables in the reports had discrepancies between the disaggregated values and the total. MCA M&E was unable to resolve these issues during the closeout period. MCC decided to take the lowest of all displayed values. Because of this, no sex disaggregation was added for this region. The sex disaggregation therefore only comprises the regions Dosso, Maradi, and Tahoua. Target

description.narrative: Level Output of USADF reported data on the number of grantees trained across a number of categories: business development, book-keeping, marketing, client prospection and contract development, etc. However, the categories were not mutually exclusive, meaning one grantee could be trained on 2 or more topics, and therefore be counted multiple times. To avoid this, MCC M&E decided to take the category with the highest number of trainees (i.e. assume 100% overlap between all categories to avoid double counting).

comment.narrative: USADF reported data on the number of grantees trained across a number of categories: business development, book-keeping, marketing, client prospection and contract development, etc. However, the categories were not mutually exclusive, meaning one grantee could be trained on 2 or more topics, and therefore be counted multiple times. To avoid this, MCC M&E decided to take the category with the highest number of trainees (i.e. assume 100% overlap between all categories to avoid double counting). Baseline

USADF reported data on the number of grantees trained across a number of categories: business development, book-keeping, marketing, client prospection and contract development, etc. However, the categories were not mutually exclusive, meaning one grantee could be trained on 2 or more topics, and therefore be counted multiple times. To avoid this, MCC M&E decided to take the category with the highest number of trainees (i.e. assume 100% overlap between all categories to avoid double counting). Target

USADF reported data on the number of grantees trained across a number of categories: business development, book-keeping, marketing, client prospection and contract development, etc. However, the categories were not mutually exclusive, meaning one grantee could be trained on 2 or more topics, and therefore be counted multiple times. To avoid this, MCC M&E decided to take the category with the highest number of trainees (i.e. assume 100% overlap between all categories to avoid double counting). Actual

description.narrative: Cumulative Output of This indicator was not reported cumulatively. For each quarterly report, the number beneficiaries was reported, but whether or not these beneficiaries were exactly the same as the previous quarter was not tracked. USADF also informed MCC that beneficiaries might be associated with multiple grants. In order to not over-represent the final figure and avoid double counting, MCC M&E decided to take one value: the value from the quarter with the highest number of beneficiaries. This value is thus under-counted.

In order to not over-represent the final figure and avoid double counting, MCC M&E decided to take one value: the value from the quarter with the highest number of beneficiaries. This value is thus under-counted. Baseline

description.narrative: Cumulative Output of This data was provided on an individual grantee level for all grantees. In some cases, the size of the storage unit(s) was reported, but the number of units was not reported. In other cases, the number of units was reported but the size was blank. Further, in some cases, the size of the storage unit was reported without units, or with different units which are not directly comparable (e.g. tonnes as opposed to meters squared). MCC could not confirm the final value with USADF before the end of the closeout period.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project - Livestock Activity: MCC Funding will be used to support pastoralist groups and enhance regional integration by improving livestock health, upgrading water and rangeland resources along major transhumance Livestock Corridors and modernizing local livestock market infrastructure (the Project Regional d'Appui au Pastoralisme au Sahel/Niger or "PRAPS Activity").
Capital of Niger, Niamey
Niger-Compact-Agriculture Project-Livestock Activity Account Budget Item

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project - Livestock Activity: MCC Funding will be used to support pastoralist groups and enhance regional integration by improving livestock health, upgrading water and rangeland resources along major transhumance Livestock Corridors and modernizing local livestock market infrastructure (the Project Regional d'Appui au Pastoralisme au Sahel/Niger or "PRAPS Activity").

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project - Diversified Agriculture Activity: MCC Funding will be used to support sustainable increases in productivity and farm incomes in Eligible Communes by strengthening the resiliency of farmers and agro-pastoralists to the impacts of climate (the "Climate-Resilient Agriculture Activity" or "CRA Activity").
Dosso Region
Maradi Region
Tahoua Region
Tillaberi Region

condition.narrative: Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project - Diversified Agriculture Activity: MCC Funding will be used to support sustainable increases in productivity and farm incomes in Eligible Communes by strengthening the resiliency of farmers and agro-pastoralists to the impacts of climate (the "Climate-Resilient Agriculture Activity" or "CRA Activity").

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET): Through the compact's Irrigation and Market Access Project, MCC will partner with the Government of Niger to improve irrigation, including the rehabilitation and development of three large-scale irrigation systems, in order to increase crop yields, sustainable fishing and livestock productivity. The project will upgrade road networks to significantly improve access to markets and services, provide technical support for farmers, with a focus on women and youth, to improve performance of their businesses and establish market platforms to competitively position farmer groups in the marketplace. In addition, the project will reform policies and institutions, including the establishment of a national water resource management plan and natural resource and land use management plans, and create local capacities to increase understanding of best-practices to sustainably use and maintain irrigation, road and market infrastructure. The project will focus its interventions in the Dosso and Tahoua regions.

condition.narrative: Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

The Government will have delivered satisfactory evidence that it has prepared and adopted a road maintenance plan for the portion of the road network associated with the Irrigation and Market Access Project, which plan will (i) address, at a minimum, the preventative, routine, and periodic maintenance of each of RN7 and RN35; and (ii) ensure the availability of funds for the continued maintenance post-Compact through the operation of any performance-based management and maintenance contracts to sustain the investments from the Roads for Market Access Activity and the community-based maintenance system for the Sambera Rural Road

The Government will have issued an appropriate legal instrument, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, (a) allowing for the creation of IWUAs; (b) permitting the IWUAs to manage, operate, and maintain, on a long-term basis, the perimeter systems in the Activityï¿½s project areas; (c) affirming womenï¿½s eligibility to IWUA members and reserving a minimum percentage of seats on IWUA boards and committees for women; and (d) clarifying roles and responsibilities among such IWUAs, cooperatives, and ONAHA

The Government will provide evidence it has issued a communication directed at the farmers and cooperatives confirming that the farmers and cooperatives have the right in the Project intervention areas to determine their own choice of crops, without Government mandate, consistent with water availability and the requirements for rational and equitable distribution of water within the perimeters
The Government will provide evidence of its compliance with its international obligations implicated by the Activity (including, but not limited to, the Ramsar Convention).
The Government will provide evidence of its compliance with its international obligations implicated by this Sub-Activity (including, but not limited to, the Sokoto Agreement).

The Government will provide, for the applicable areas covered by the construction or works contract, evidence of integration of the land use plans into the applicable local commune-level development plans in a manner consistent with the requirements of the IFC Performance Standards, the stakeholder engagement strategy and Activity-specific stakeholder engagement plans

The Government will, for the applicable area covered by such construction or works contract, (i) adopt and publish an arrete that is legally binding on the local authorities establishing local socially acceptable processes and criteria for land allocation, which Land Allocation Procedures will be consistent with the Land Allocation Core Principles agreed by MCC and the Government; and (ii) submit evidence satisfactory to MCC demonstrating that such arrete remains in full force and effect throughout the Compact Term.

description.narrative:
Level Outcome of 90 AVEC mï¿½rs for Konni+ 9 for Gaya reported to 103 AVEC for Konni + 10 for Gaya Number of AVEC (VSL groups) who complete a year of training / number of AVEC
The SCOOP was set up in July 2020, which allowed it to work for 3 years to provide services to members; it is the connection with COSPE partners for the UT of livestock feed production, participation in fairs, the contract for the production of peanut seeds and seeds, study trips, the supply of seeds and fertilizers, the CRA subsidy and the IFDC fertilizer etc.

title.narrative: Farmers who have applied improved practices as a result of training

description.narrative: Cumulative Outcome of The producers trained in PVP simply capitalized on the techniques taught without applying them in their own plots. The application of the learned techniques has therefore been delayed. Only the farners with significant financial and material means are able to apply those techniques in their additional farms outside of the perimeter.

description.narrative: Cumulative Output of The target for Konni was calculated by the MCC Land Team. They had a fairly accurate estimate for Konni based on the parcel plan from that time (since replaced and improved with Compact support). The weak component of the estimate was Sia-Kouanza, for which they did not have firm information regarding surface areas targeted for irrigation or the populations of farmers on that surface area.

description.narrative: Date Output of There is no plan for Rural Road maintenance. Communities make repairs as needs arise. This indicator is completed with the achievement of (i) the establishment of a Second Generation Road Maintenance Fund; (ii) a functional Road Maintenance Agency; (iii) an Independent Auditor for road maintenance funds.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Farm to Market Roads Activity: MCC Funding will be used to reduce trade barriers and improve physical market access through targeted improvements of the road network serving the Dosso-Gaya perimeters and linking them to the rest of the country (the "Roads for Market Access Activity").
MCC Funding will support the rehabilitation and gravel upgrade of approximately 187 km of the RN35 road directly serving the Dosso-Gaya perimeters ("RN35").
MCC Funding will support the rehabilitation and gravel upgrade of approximately 187 km of the RN35 road directly serving the Dosso-Gaya perimeters ("RN35").
MCC Funding will support the rehabilitation and gravel upgrade of approximately 37 km of rural road that links the Ouna-Kouanza and Sia irrigation perimeters with the RN7 ("Sambera Rural Road").
MCC Funding will support the rehabilitation and gravel upgrade of approximately 37 km of rural road that links the Ouna-Kouanza and Sia irrigation perimeters with the RN7 ("Sambera Rural Road").

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Farm to Market Roads Activity: MCC Funding will be used to reduce trade barriers and improve physical market access through targeted improvements of the road network serving the Dosso-Gaya perimeters and linking them to the rest of the country (the "Roads for Market Access Activity").

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Policy Activity: MCC Funding will be used to promote several major policy reforms directly linked to the success and sustainability of the Program (the "Policy Reform Activity").
Capital of Niger, Niamey

On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Policy Activity: MCC Funding will be used to promote several major policy reforms directly linked to the success and sustainability of the Program (the "Policy Reform Activity").

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Irrigation Activity: MCC Funding will be used to rehabilitate the Konni irrigation system and develop new irrigated perimeters in the Dosso-Gaya area (the "Irrigation Perimeter Development Activity"). Includes both construction and non-constructions costs.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Irrigation Activity: MCC Funding will be used to rehabilitate the Konni irrigation system and develop new irrigated perimeters in the Dosso-Gaya area (the "Irrigation Perimeter Development Activity"). Includes both construction and non-constructions costs.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Water Management and Irrigation Activity: MCC Funding will be used to establish a suite of institutional and management support activities designed to ensure the achievement of Project Objectives in the irrigated perimeters targeted by the Irrigation Perimeter Development Activity (the "Management Services and Market Facilitation Activity"). The Management Services and Market Facilitation Activity will be implemented using a community-based approach to provide services that address the entire production chain, including the supply of agricultural inputs, the yields obtained by farming, the marketing of produce and the sustainable use of natural resources.
Capital of Niger, Niamey

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - IRRIGATED AGRICULTURE PROJECT (WATER TO MARKET) - Water Management and Irrigation Activity: MCC Funding will be used to establish a suite of institutional and management support activities designed to ensure the achievement of Project Objectives in the irrigated perimeters targeted by the Irrigation Perimeter Development Activity (the "Management Services and Market Facilitation Activity"). The Management Services and Market Facilitation Activity will be implemented using a community-based approach to provide services that address the entire production chain, including the supply of agricultural inputs, the yields obtained by farming, the marketing of produce and the sustainable use of natural resources.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
The Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Niger, monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Pending subsequent report: Non-allocated funds requested by the MCA Niger which have yet to be reallocated to a project/activity by the MCA on their financial reports.

An Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Niger, administrative costs, which include staff salaries; Accountable Entity facilities; IT software, hardware and support; fiscal and procurement agent costs; audit costs; and general overhead costs.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
An Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Niger, costs for its Fiscal Agent, who is responsible for overseeing the accounting and funds control procedures for the Accountable Entity.

description.narrative:
In July and early August 2023, elements of the military of Niger took actions against the democratically elected government of Niger, detained the president and key ministers, and asserted to have suspended the constitution and dissolved state institutions. In response, in August, MCC paused all new activity on the 2016 Compact and all preparatory work on the Concurrent Compact.
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors concurred with the recommendation of the MCC CEO to suspend all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete.

On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's agriculture projects to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

condition.narrative: Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

description.narrative:

Niger - Agriculture Project - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's agriculture projects to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Agriculture Project - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's agriculture projects to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Country Assessments project: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support the MCA's compact design process across multiple sectors, as well as provide external assistance to implementation oversight.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Environmental Assessments - Non-allocated Funds activity: In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to develop and oversee the implementation of an Environmental and Social Assessment.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Financial Sector project: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's financial project to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

condition.narrative: Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Health Project - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's health sector project to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Land Administration System Improvement project - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support MCC's assessment and oversight of the MCA's land administration project to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Monitoring and Evaluation project: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance and/or collect data to support the design and implementation of the MCA's M&E and Economic Analysis frameworks, through compact implementation and evaluation stages.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Monitoring and Evaluation - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance and/or collect data to support the design and implementation of the MCA's M&E and Economic Analysis frameworks, through compact implementation and evaluation stages.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - Program Development - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support the MCA's compact design process across multiple sectors.

Niger - Program Management & Support project: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to assist with the establishment of MCA IT infrastructure and systems.

description.narrative:
On September 13, 2023, MCC's Board of Directors suspended all MCC assistance to Niger, based on the finding that the military's actions against the democratically elected government constitute a pattern of actions inconsistent with the criteria used to determine the eligibility of Niger for assistance, under Section 611(a)(2) of the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, as amended, and pursuant to MCC's Policy on Suspension and Termination.
Niger - MANAGEMENT COMPONENT - Non-allocated Funds activity: Due Diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during program development, effectively oversee and monitor program implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of the project once complete. In this particular project, due diligence funds were used to hire external technical assistance to support the management of MCA Niger's water projects to ensure country-led designs and subsequent implementation were consistent with MCC guidance.
Niger-Due Diligence Fund-Water Management Component-Not Applicable Account Budget Item
